translation.en: is a losing deal much too often for comfort,
translation.ko: 음반 회사를 차리는 것이 제가 손해가 되리란 걸 압니다 "샘 쿡 인터뷰 1962년"

translation.en: but this company of mine is concentrating on recording negro artists
translation.ko: 하지만 저의 음반사는 제가 보기에 저만큼 성공할만한

translation.en: I feel have the ingredients to become as successful as I have.
translation.ko: 하지만 저의 음반사는 제가 보기에 저만큼 성공할만한 가능성이 충분한 흑인 예술가들 음반 제작에 집중하고 있습니다

translation.en: And if I lose a few dollars along the way, in the end, it will be worth it to me.
translation.ko: 돈을 좀 잃는다 해도 저에게는 가치 있는 일이에요

translation.en: Morally, it's a worthwhile project.
People think the Rolling Stones' first hit was "Satisfaction."
It wasn't. It was "It's All Over Now."
♪ Because I used to love her ♪
♪ But it's all over now ♪
And few people know that that song was written by... Bobby Womack,
translation.ko: 그 곡을 보비 워맥이 썼다는 건 사람들이 잘 몰라요

translation.en: who was a member of The Valentinos,
which was a group signed to Sam Cooke's label.
The fact that they knew Sam Cooke and admired his music as much as they did
translation.ko: 샘 쿡을 알고 있었고 그의 음악을 동경했으며

translation.en: and would want to record something by an artist affiliated with Sam Cooke
translation.ko: 샘 쿡과 계약을 맺은 아티스트와 녹음을 하고 싶은 것이

translation.en: isn't surprising at all.
SAR Records and Sam Cooke...
was a threat to every other record company in the country.
The vision was that
"We're gonna make the artist just as important as the owner...
and we're not gonna treat them as second-class citizens."
He was so forward-thinking about the industry and the control of the money.
translation.ko: 음반 산업과 돈의 통제에 대해 굉장히 진취적으로 생각했죠

translation.en: It's part of what makes Sam Cooke so dangerous.
translation.ko: 그 부분이 샘 쿡을 위험하게 만들었어요

translation.en: What could be the greatest thing in the world that would happen to you?
translation.ko: 어떤 일이 일어나면 - 제일 좋겠어요? - 최고로 좋은 일은

translation.en: The greatest thing to happen to me--if all the singers I'm connected with had hits.
translation.ko: - 제일 좋겠어요? - 최고로 좋은 일은 제가 계약한 모든 가수들이 히트곡을 내는 거죠

translation.en: Though he was making moves that could be identified as black self-empowerment,
translation.ko: 자수성가한 흑인, 음반사나 출판사로 인정을 받으며

translation.en: his own record label, his own publishing company,
at the same time,
he was grappling with, "How can I be my authentic black self
translation.ko: 어떻게 하면 흑인으로서 스스로에게 진실되게 현재 상황에

translation.en: and speak truth to what's happening?"
translation.ko: 어떻게 하면 흑인으로서 스스로에게 진실되게 현재 상황에 진실을 말할까 고심했어요

translation.en: ♪ How many roads ♪ ♪ Must a man walk down ♪
♪ Before you call him a man? ♪
It's hard to sing "Everybody Likes To Cha-Cha-Cha"
when there were songs like "Blowing in the Wind."
The combination of this Jewish brother, Bob Dylan, and that song,
translation.ko: 유대인 형제와 밥 딜런 그 노래의 조합이나

translation.en: and these black-and-white folks and other people comin' together
translation.ko: 백인, 흑인과 다른 사람들이 모두 모이는

translation.en: in places like the march on Washington
gave Sam the fuel to say,
"Okay, in some of my performances,
I'm gonna start to weave in songs like "Blowing in the Wind."
translation.ko: '바람결에 불어오네' 같은 노래들을 공연에 넣어서 부르기 시작했어요

translation.en: ♪ How many times can a mountain exist ♪
♪ 'Fore it's washed down to the sea? ♪
♪ Tell me ♪
♪ How many years can some people exist ♪
♪ Before they allowed to be free? ♪
Even if I'm gonna speed the song up so you may not catch exactly what I'm doing,
translation.ko: 제가 노래를 빨리 재생한다면 감이 안 잡히는 사람도 있겠지만

translation.en: but those who know will know, "Hey, he's now performing an anthem, a political anthem."
translation.ko: 아는 사람은 알아요 정치적인 노래란 사실을요

translation.en: ♪ Oh, the answer, my friend ♪
translation.ko: 오, 친구여, 그 대답은 바람결에 불어오네

translation.en: ♪ Is blowin' in the wind, ah ♪
translation.ko: 오, 친구여, 그 대답은 바람결에 불어오네 그 대답은 바람결에 불어오네

translation.en: ♪That answer blowin' in the wind, oh ♪
Sam is moved by the ideas in "Blowing in the Wind,"
but he's also embarrassed.
Why is it Bob Dylan, this white artist,
translation.ko: 왜 밥 딜런 같은 백인 아티스트가

translation.en: who is speaking to the masses about social change at this moment,
translation.ko: 흑인 민권 운동 중간에 사회적 변화에 대해

translation.en: during the midst of the Civil Rights movement?
Why aren't we seeing black artists do that themselves?
translation.ko: 왜 흑인 아티스들이 스스로 하는 모습이 안 보이나?

translation.en: ♪There been times that I thought ♪
♪ I couldn't last for long... ♪
I came by the session when they were recording "Change is Gonna Come,"
translation.ko: '변화가 찾아올 거야'를 녹음할 때 들른 적이 있는데

translation.en: and my hair stood up, you know.
He wanted to write things like that,
and it was amazing how well that came out.
♪ It's been a long ♪ ♪ A long time comin' ♪
♪ But I know ♪ ♪ Change gonna come ♪
You know, as a singer grows older,
translation.ko: 가수가 나이가 들면서 생각도 조금 더 깊어집니다

translation.en: his conception goes a little deeper because he lives life,
translation.ko: 가수가 나이가 들면서 생각도 조금 더 깊어집니다 "샘 쿡 인터뷰 1963년" 살아오며 무슨 말을 하고 싶은지 조금 더 이해하게 되니까요

translation.en: and he understands what he's trying to say a little more.
translation.ko: 살아오며 무슨 말을 하고 싶은지 조금 더 이해하게 되니까요

translation.en: I think if a singer tries to find out what's happening in life,
translation.ko: 가수가 삶에서 일어나는 일을 이해하려고 한다면

translation.en: it gives him a better insight on telling the story of the song he's trying to sing.
translation.ko: 노래로 무슨 이야기를 할지에 대해 더 나은 통찰력이 생기겠죠

translation.en: I told him, I said, "Man, it sounded like eerie.
It sounded like death or something, you know."
He said, "Well, you know what? It is like death. It's the death of the old me
translation.ko: 샘은 맞다고 하더라고요 과거의 자신이 죽고

translation.en: and a birth of the new me."
He said, "That's what I was thinkin' about when I wrote this song.
translation.ko: 그 노래를 쓸 때 그런 생각을 했대요

translation.en: That, uh, it's gonna come, but I wanna be a part of makin' it happen."
translation.ko: 그리고 변화를 만드는 데 일조하고 싶다고요

translation.en: There is no doubt about Sam moving more into the center of the movement
translation.ko: 확실히 샘은 운동의 중심으로 한 발 더 다가갔어요

translation.en: because the satisfaction of hit records...
didn't do it.
Just like touchdowns didn't do it for me.
[male announcer] Browns' Jimmy Brown blasts his way right down the middle
with a sensational scoring run.
And if you were a popular celebrity that had crossover value,
translation.ko: 두 사회에 발을 담고 있는 유명한 연예인이라면

translation.en: you did have the pressure of were you going to be careful,
or were you going to be truthful? Were you going to be real?
[Clay] I'm ready to rumble.
I can't be beat.
I'm the champ.
Sam and I and a bunch of people all went to see the fight.
translation.ko: 샘과 저, 그리고 한 무리가 경기를 보러 갔어요

translation.en: All of a sudden, all these Muslims were around us.
Malcolm X was there. I shook his hand.
translation.ko: 맬컴 X도 거기 있었어요 악수를 했죠

translation.en: [Brown] Malcolm X, Sam Cooke,
Ali and myself.
It was a rare experience for all of us to be in one place at the same time.
translation.ko: 한자리에 모두 모이다니 흔치 않은 경험이었어요

translation.en: We're almost all set to go for that World Heavyweight Championship fight.
translation.ko: 헤비급 세계 챔피언십 경기를 곧 시작합니다

translation.en: When I found out that Jim Brown, Sam Cooke, Muhammad Ali aka Cassius Clay,
translation.ko: 짐 브라운, 샘 쿡, 캐시어스 클레이로도 알려진 무하마드 알리

translation.en: and Malcolm X were all connected,
translation.ko: 맬컴 X가 다 연결돼 있다는 걸 알고

translation.en: I said, "What an amazing connection,
but what a huge threat to America at that time."
Malcolm X is the oldest of them, the political theorist, if you will.
translation.ko: 맬컴 X가 그중 제일 연장자였고 정치적 이론가라고 볼 수 있었죠

translation.en: Sam Cooke's only 33 years old.
Great well-known singer, but in many ways, a business genius, right?
And then you have these two 20-something professional athletes
translation.ko: 그리고 젊은 백인들이 좋아하는 20대의 프로 운동 선수

translation.en: who young and white folks adore.
What you see is this interesting kind of moment in the early stage development of what we might call black power.
translation.ko: 흑인 민권 운동 초창기에 이런 흥미로운 순간이 있었던 거죠

translation.en: -[bell dings] -[Clay] I am the greatest.
[announcer] Overconfidence. This can happen.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 일어나고 있죠? 이럴 수는...

translation.en: [Clay] This is the legend of Cassius Clay,
the most beautiful fighter in the world today.
-[bell clangs] -Look at the guy yawning.
[Clay] This brash young boxer is something to see,
and the Heavyweight Championship is his destiny.
He is the greatest.
[announcer] They might be stopping it. That might be all, ladies and gentlemen.
Get up there, Joe.
Sam Cooke is front and center,
and he watches Clay become heavyweight champion in the world.
translation.ko: 클레이가 세계 챔피언이 되는 걸 지켜 봅니다

translation.en: At that moment, Clay's yelling at the sportswriters,
translation.ko: 당시에 클레이가 스포츠 기자들에게 소리를 치며

translation.en: tellin 'em that, "I told ya." He's pointing fingers.
And he yells out, "Sam Cooke. Sam Cooke's the greatest.
translation.ko: 고함을 질렀어요 '샘 쿡! 샘 쿡이 최고다!'

translation.en: Come on, Sam. Come up here."
Hey, let that man up here. Let Sam in. World's greatest rock-'n'-roll singer.
translation.ko: 올라오게 해 주세요 로큰롤의 스타 샘이에요

translation.en: This is Sam Cooke.
Sam Cooke, a very good friend, a good vocalist, with Cassius.
translation.ko: 캐시어스의 친한 친구 샘 쿡이에요 다들 아시죠, 실례합니다

translation.en: Excuse me. Move back, if you will.
translation.ko: 캐시어스의 친한 친구 샘 쿡이에요 다들 아시죠, 실례합니다 뒤로 좀 물러서요

translation.en: -Did I shake up the world? -You are beautiful.
We all ended up that night in this little black motel.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 모두 작은 흑인 모텔에 모였어요

translation.en: It became sort of historical.
We just shared our thoughts.
Standing up was a big thing for all of us...
because we defied second-class citizenship
and being considered inferior.
Being outspoken, the risk was to lose money
translation.ko: 거침없이 나서는 건 돈을 잃을 위험도 있지만

translation.en: or to lose your popularity with Middle America...
translation.ko: 미국 중부에서 인기를 잃을 위험도 있었어요

translation.en: but those of us who, uh...
were there that night cared nothing about that.
We were talkin' about standing up as human beings and demanding our rights.
translation.ko: 인간으로서 당당히 우리 권리를 요구하는 것에 대해 이야기했죠

translation.en: That black male energy that Sam Cooke possessed,
translation.ko: 샘 쿡이 갖고 있는 흑인 남자의 에너지

translation.en: that Malcolm X possessed, that Cassius Clay possessed--
translation.ko: 맬컴 X와 캐시어스 클레이가 가진 에너지가

translation.en: unfortunately for some people in power in this country,
represented a threat that had to be stopped,
and that's why informants were all around those folks.
And little did we know that one year after that,
both Sam Cooke and Malcolm X would be dead.
translation.ko: 샘 쿡과 맬컴 X가 죽을 거라곤 아무도 몰랐어요

translation.en: Malcolm X and Muhammad Ali were being surveilled by the FBI.
translation.ko: 맬컴 X와 무하마드 알리는 FBI 감시를 받았어요

translation.en: So Sam Cooke gets caught up in all of that, also.
In these FBI documents, you know, he's this negro recording star from Los Angeles
translation.ko: FBI 문서들을 보면 LA의 검둥이 음반 스타라고 나와요

translation.en: who's spending time with Muslims. Well, that was Sam Cooke.
What was he doing politically that they might find threatening.
translation.ko: 샘이 어떤 위협적인 정치 활동을 하는지 알려고 했죠 "미연방수사국"

translation.en: If you're J. Edgar Hoover, who was always concerned and fearful
translation.ko: 존 에드거 후버는 흑인들의 급진적인 변화를

translation.en: of the radicalization of black people,
and you're looking at these four men,
Sam Cooke might be the most dangerous to you
translation.ko: 샘 쿡이 가장 위험할 수 있죠

translation.en: because he's already in white American living rooms.
translation.ko: 이미 백인 미국 가정의 안방을 차지했으니까요

translation.en: Cassius Clay announces the next day, "My name is now Muhammad Ali."
translation.ko: 캐시어스가 다음날 자기 이름은 무하마드 알리라고 발표했어요

translation.en: Clay was a white man's name. It was a slave name.
And I'm no longer Clay, I'm no longer a slave,
so now I'm Muhammad Ali.
Because he's a clean-living young man,
and this is the main thing that the honorable Elijah Muhammad
does teach in spreading the religion of Islam throughout the--
translation.ko: 이슬람교와 이 나라에 있는 우리 이슬람 사람들에게

translation.en: among our people in this country.
We saw a picture of Sam with Malcolm X,
and we were askin' him, "Was he thinkin' about turnin' to be a Muslim?"
And he's like, "Nah, man."
Sam was drawn to the economical part of it--
owning and having your own.
We didn't see the Muslims here as spiritual.
It was more educational. About self independence.
translation.ko: 오히려 자립하는 법을 배울 수 있다고 봤어요

translation.en: That's what it all was about.
I'm sure the RCA marketing people
translation.ko: RCA 홍보팀은 샘이 맬컴 X와 어울리는 걸

translation.en: would've had great concern that Sam was hanging out with Malcolm X.
translation.ko: RCA 홍보팀은 샘이 맬컴 X와 어울리는 걸 굉장히 염려했을 거예요

translation.en: They would've feared the loss of considerable portion of Sam's audience.
If you're RCA, you don't want your mainstream black artist
talking about those kind of politics,
so there's a second verse of "Change is Gonna Come"
that was famously deleted when it was initially released,
that very explicitly talks about segregation
translation.ko: 정확하게 분열과 남부의 흑인 차별 정책에 대해

translation.en: and Jim Crow segregation in the South.
♪ And I go downtown ♪
♪ Somebody keep telling me ♪ ♪ Don't hang around ♪
And I think it's very telling that, you know,
the record company deleted that verse because they were concerned
about what kind of reaction the public would have
with this very political verse in the song.
At that moment in his career,
Sam was a musical icon, a culture hero, who had reached out to white audiences,
translation.ko: "샘 쿡의 가장 큰 공연" 음악계 아이콘, 문화 영웅으로 백인들에게 다가가

translation.en: and had a real foothold in those white audiences,
translation.ko: 그 백인 청중들에게 지지 기반을 두고

translation.en: and could play a show like the Copa, and it's incredibly successful.
translation.ko: 그 백인 청중들에게 지지 기반을 두고 '코파' 같은 공연을 할 수 있었죠 굉장히 성공적이었죠

translation.en: And yet, he never had left his black audience.
translation.ko: 그러면서도 흑인 청중을 떠난 적도 없죠

translation.en: And you hear all of that in "Live at the Harlem Square,"
and "Bring It On Home To Me"
is just such an amazing, powerful moment on that record.
♪ I'll always be your slave ♪
♪ Till I'm buried ♪ ♪ Buried in my grave ♪
♪ But while I'm livin', bring it to me, Bring back-- ♪
There's something else in that "Harlem Square" recording
that's so much grittier and blacker.
♪ Everybody's with me tonight ♪ ♪ Look, listen, let me hear you say yeah ♪
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 모두 나와 함께 해! 모두의 이야기를 들어볼게

translation.en: There is something terribly tragic
that folks didn't get to hear the "Harlem Square" album... until 1985.
translation.ko: 1985년이 되어서야 사람들이 듣게 된 건 정말 비극적인 일이에요

translation.en: I think there's probably several reasons
translation.ko: "할렘 스퀘어 클럽 라이브 1963년" 녹음 당시에 공개되지 않은 데는 몇 가지 이유가 있을 거예요

translation.en: why it wasn't released at the time it was recorded.
translation.ko: 녹음 당시에 공개되지 않은 데는 몇 가지 이유가 있을 거예요

translation.en: I can't discount the fact that RCA didn't relate to it on a commercial level.
translation.ko: RCA가 노래의 상업성을 이해 못 한 사실도 무시할 수 없죠

translation.en: Forget about... you know, too R&B, too black... or whatever.
translation.ko: 너무... 리듬 앤드 블루스 느낌이거나 흑인답다는 이유가 아니더라도요

translation.en: That was not the guy they wanted playing Vegas and the Copa,
translation.ko: 베가스와 코파에서 그런 공연을 원하진 않았죠

translation.en: which were things Sam wanted as well,
but Sam felt there was room to do both of those. The record industry didn't.
translation.ko: 샘은 둘 다 할 수 있는 여유가 있다고 생각했어요 음반 시장은 반대였지만요

translation.en: I think the more they pushed it aside, the more Sam pushed forward with it
translation.ko: 음반사에서 밀어낼수록 샘은 더 밀고 간 것 같아요

translation.en: because he had to be who he was. He had to fulfill that.
These things had been important to him for a very long time.
translation.ko: 굉장히 오랜 시간 본인에게 중요한 문제였고요

translation.en: Sam really wanted to build an empire.
He felt he could do it,
translation.ko: 할 수 있다고 생각했고 "젤다 샌즈 샘 쿡의 사무실 매니저"

translation.en: and he was not afraid to do it.
Sam had an ideal of getting all the big entertainers
translation.ko: 재키 윌슨, 제임스 브라운 같은 엔터테인먼트 거물들을 모아서

translation.en: like Jackie Wilson, James Brown... to put all their money together,
translation.ko: 재키 윌슨, 제임스 브라운 같은 엔터테인먼트 거물들을 모아서 자본은 한데 모아 대형 음반사를 시작할 꿈을 꿨죠

translation.en: and let's start our own big record company and booking agency all within one.
translation.ko: 자본은 한데 모아 대형 음반사를 시작할 꿈을 꿨죠 연예 기획사도 같이요

translation.en: The mob has always been involved in the record industry...
translation.ko: 음반 산업에 늘 마피아가 관련돼 있었죠

translation.en: simply because it's a lucrative business.
He would get phone calls, and he would get visits from mob figures
translation.ko: 마피아들이 샘에게 전화도 하고 찾아오기도 했어요 "에릭 그린 작가 / 조카 손주"

translation.en: who wanted a piece of his businesses.
There were some guys that came up to Sam's dressing room,
and he would never let us leave the dressing room.
He said, "Anything you can say, you can say with my little brothers."
So they were like, "Sam, look here.
We hear you're tryin' to start a music union of your own,
translation.ko: 직접 음악 노조를 만드려는 것 같은데

translation.en: and we want you to leave that alone."
But he's like, "Well, fuck all y'all.
I don't give a damn about that shit.
Hell, I'm gonna-- I will do what I wanna do."
And Sammy Davis even called Sam, said, uh...
"You got to listen to these guys. These guys are serious guys."
It was very courageous and was scary, too, you know, 'cause a lot of people was...
"Oh, man. Oh, no, you can't mess with that." You know.
"I don't wanna get killed." You know.
I got a phone call at the office,
and they wanted to have him come home... immediately.
translation.ko: 샘한테 당장 집에 오라는 연락이었어요, 문제가 생겼죠

translation.en: There was trouble.
And he went home and found out that his son died.
translation.ko: 집에 가 보니 아들이 죽어 있었어요

translation.en: Vincent was... by the pool,
translation.ko: 빈센트가 수영장 옆에 있었는데 아내가 잠깐 집에 들어간 사이

translation.en: and Sam's wife went in the house for a little while,
translation.ko: 수영장 옆에 있었는데 아내가 잠깐 집에 들어간 사이

translation.en: and he just slipped into the pool... and he died.
And, uh, it affected Sam a lot.
It took a long time for him to be able to even talk about it.
translation.ko: 이야기를 꺼내는 것만 해도 오래 걸렸어요

translation.en: And then it was a touchy subject
that you don't wanna bring those kind of things up to anybody.
translation.ko: 누구한테도 말하고 싶지 않은 민감한 주제였어요

translation.en: Every time he walked in the house, he walked right by the pool
translation.ko: 집에 갈 때마다 앞뜰에 수영장 옆을 지나야 했어요

translation.en: in the front yard that his son died in.
So he didn't have a lot of peaceful days at home after that.
translation.ko: 그 후로 집에서 편안히 못 지냈어요

translation.en: It affected his marriage a lot.
I would sit many a time at the dinner table...
and Sam would get up to go out.
And Barbara suspected what he was doing. Every-- we all knew.
translation.ko: 바버라는 샘이 뭘 하는지 알았죠 다들 알았어요

translation.en: He was a womanizer.
He started drinking a little bit more Beefeaters.
translation.ko: 샘이 비피터 진을 좀 더 마시기 시작했어요

translation.en: He... It changed him.
After Vincent died, all he wanted to do was work. He poured himself into his work.
translation.ko: 빈센트가 죽은 후로 오로지 일에만 매달렸어요

translation.en: Immediately wanted to go on tour. "Let's go."
♪ And I know, I know, I know ♪ ♪ A ring that's rollin' ♪
♪ Has no end ♪
♪ And, oh ♪
♪ A baby when it's sleepin' ♪
♪ There's no cryin' ♪
♪ A baby when-- ♪
He's masking the very real pain and loss in his life-- the loss of a son.
And that's in concert with just the added pressures of being Sam Cooke,
translation.ko: 샘 쿡으로 살면서 받는 압박감에 그것까지 더해진 거죠

translation.en: as being famous, as being a celebrity,
as being what most white folks
translation.ko: 유명하고 연예인이고 백인이 볼 때는 흑인에게 자랑거리라는 부담감요

translation.en: would've thought of as a credit to the race.
translation.ko: 백인이 볼 때는 흑인에게 자랑거리라는 부담감요

translation.en: That doesn't come without a price.
It was renegotiation time at RCA...
so Allen Klein, who's become Sam's manager,
"I'll tell you what. I'll negotiate the contract."
translation.ko: 제안을 했어요 자기가 계약 협상을 하겠다고요

translation.en: And they came up with a concept where they'd create their own record company,
translation.ko: 그리고 RCA에서 나와서 독립 음반사를 차리자는

translation.en: separate from RCA, and then lease the material out to RCA.
translation.ko: 아이디어를 냈죠 음반은 RCA에게 임대해 주고요

translation.en: The company was named Tracey Limited,
and Tracey was the name of Sam's middle daughter.
And how it was explained to Sam
was that this would be a venture
where Sam would own the company,
own the rights to the recorded materials,
be in charge in the studio, which is something he really wanted.
translation.ko: 스튜디오 책임자가 되는 것이었죠 샘이 몹시 원했던 바였어요

translation.en: It turns out that Sam was bedridden around this time.
translation.ko: 이때 샘이 몸이 안 좋아 누워있었어요

translation.en: He had the flu.
What that time period did was give Sam a chance
to look through his papers,
and he realized that there were things that weren't right
as far as the ownership of his music business,
and he realized that, "Wait a minute. Things are very wrong."
I can imagine... it would be quite a shock...
when he learned that the real effect of all of this paperwork
is that Allen Klein was the owner of Tracey Limited,
translation.ko: 소유주는 앨런 클라인이란 걸 알게 됐죠

translation.en: which, in effect, makes Sam...
an employee... of Allen Klein.
Before he died, Sam said to me, "I'm gonna leave that asshole."
translation.ko: 죽기 전에 저한테 샘이 그 망할 자식과 헤어진다고 했죠

translation.en: That Thursday, he had proclaimed that he was gonna fly to New York Monday
translation.ko: 그 주 목요일에 다음 월요일에 뉴욕으로 가서

translation.en: and make a whole lot of changes, including firing Allen Klein,
translation.ko: 다 바꿔 놓을 것이며 앨런 클라인을 해고할 거라고 했죠

translation.en: but he never made it through the weekend.
Sam and I had talked earlier in the day,
translation.ko: 그 날 저는 샘과 저녁 식사를 함께하기로 했어요

translation.en: and we were gonna meet... for dinner... at Martoni's,
translation.ko: 그 날 저는 샘과 저녁 식사를 함께하기로 했어요 코헹가에 음악 공연을 하는 마토니라는 큰 식당이었어요

translation.en: which was a big music hangout on Cahuenga.
translation.ko: 코헹가에 음악 공연을 하는 마토니라는 큰 식당이었어요

translation.en: I had brought my wife at the time, Joan, with me.
Sam had... a few martinis.
He liked his martinis, and, uh...
and we were talking about... we were gonna do a blues album.
translation.ko: 그리고 저희는 블루스 앨범을 하자는 이야기를 나눴어요

translation.en: Sam pulled out a big wad of money from his pocket.
translation.ko: 샘이 주머니에서 돈 뭉치를 꺼냈어요 "조앤 듀 기자 / 알 슈밋의 전부인"

translation.en: I mean, it was like a fistful of money.
translation.ko: 한 움큼 정도 되는 돈을 쥐고

translation.en: And he said to Al, he said,
"I just came in off the road and look what I got,"
or "Look what I earned," or something like that.
And Al said to him, "Yeah. Sam, don't be flashing that money here.
translation.ko: 앨이 여기에서 그렇게 돈 자랑 말라고 했죠

translation.en: Put it back in your pocket. Don't show that around."
And Sam kind of laughed, you know, because in Sam's mind,
nobody ever would try to take money from Sam Cooke. Are you serious?
translation.ko: 감히 누구도 샘의 돈을 뺏어갈 수 없었겠죠

translation.en: I mean, in his mind, he was invincible.
When we got up to leave,
translation.ko: 우리는 일어나서 나갔고 샘은 바로 갔어요

translation.en: Sam went up to the bar, and this woman was there.
translation.ko: 우리는 일어나서 나갔고 샘은 바로 갔어요 이 여자가 거기 있었죠

translation.en: When we left... as I recall, he was still at the bar,
translation.ko: 우리가 나갈 때 제 기억으로는 샘은 바에 있었어요

translation.en: you know, talking, laughing, carrying on.
Now...
there's all kinds of things that go on with what happened after that.
translation.ko: 그 후에 일어난 일에 대해서는 여러 말이 많아요

translation.en: [female] The number is PL79984.
-[male] 79984? -That's a telephone booth I'm at.
-Uh-huh. What street are you on? -[female sighs]
-I don't know. -What's your problem there?
Well, I-I was kidnapped.
-You were kidnapped? -Right.
-But you have no idea where you're at? -[female sighs]
No, it's pretty dark here.
Can you stay right there in the phone booth?
-Right. -I'll find out where you are.
-You stay right where you're at. -I will.
-Ok. -Bye.
-What is your name? -[female hangs up]
Joan and I got home... went to bed. Five o'clock, the phone rang.
translation.ko: 조앤과 집에 와서 잠자리에 들었는데 5시에 전화가 왔어요

translation.en: And I heard that Sam Cooke...
was shot.
I went to the police station,
wanting to know more details about what had actually happened.
translation.ko: 어떻게 된 일인지 자세하게 알아보려고 했죠

translation.en: The desk sergeant said, "What is going on here?
We've had calls from everywhere.
We even had a phone call from London. Who the hell is... Sam Cooke?
translation.ko: 대체 샘 쿡이 누구길래 런던에서도 전화가 온다고요

translation.en: Just another n-word killed in Watts. What is the big deal?"
translation.ko: 흑인 하나 죽었을 뿐인데 뭐가 대수냐고요

translation.en: So I told him he was a fucking idiot.
I joined the Los Angeles Police Department in May of 1959.
translation.ko: 1959년 5월에 LA 경찰에서 일하기 시작했습니다 "노먼 에델렌 작가 /샘 사망시 LA 경찰"

translation.en: The attitude of the police at 77th Street toward the black community
was just purely suppressive.
All blacks look alike, and all Asians look alike. Right?
translation.ko: 모든 흑인들이 생김새가 비슷하고 모든 동양인들도 그렇잖아요?

translation.en: The official story is that Sam went out the night of December tenth
translation.ko: 공식적인 이야기에 따르면 샘이 12월 10일 밤에 외출해서

translation.en: and met a woman named Lisa Boyer
in a restaurant called Martoni's,
and he left with her and went to the Hacienda Motel.
translation.ko: 여자와 함께 식당을 나와 하시엔다 모텔로 갔어요

translation.en: And he... dragged me into that room.
translation.ko: 그 사람이 저를 방에 끌고 들어갔어요

translation.en: I started talking very loudly, and I told him, "Please take me home."
translation.ko: 저는 큰 소리로 집에 데려다 달라고 외쳤죠

translation.en: He latched the night latch on... and, um...
he pushed me on the bed, and he says, "Well, we're just gonna talk."
translation.ko: 저를 침대로 밀쳤어요 그냥 이야기나 하자고 했지만

translation.en: I knew that he was about to rape me...
so while he was in the bathroom, I picked up my clothes, my shoes, and my handbag.
translation.ko: 그래서 욕실에 있는 동안 제 옷과 신발, 가방을 들고

translation.en: I opened the latch, and I ran out.
She grabs his pants... runs out,
translation.ko: 그 여자가 샘의 바지를 들고 뛰쳐나갔어요

translation.en: so he went to the manager's door and started bangin' on the door,
translation.ko: 그래서 샘이 관리실에 가서 문을 쾅쾅 치기 시작했죠 그 여자가

translation.en: 'cause he thought... the girl was in there.
translation.ko: 문을 쾅쾅 치기 시작했죠 그 여자가 안에 있는 줄 알고요

translation.en: Miss Franklin stated that the deceased came to the door...
translation.ko: 프랭클린 부인은 고인이 문 앞에 와서

translation.en: and started pounding and shouting and asking if his lady friend was inside.
translation.ko: 문을 내리치며 안에 여자가 있냐고 소리치기 시작했다고 진술했습니다

translation.en: And at this time, the deceased...
broke the door open.
And he grabbed both of my arms
and started twistin' 'em and asked me where was the girl.
I started kickin' ,and I-- he maybe have a bite. I don't know.
But I tried bite him through that jacket.
[man] You tried to bite Mr. Cooke?
translation.ko: - 쿡 씨를 물려고 했다고요? - 네, 때리고 할퀴고 물었어요

translation.en: Yeah, I was fightin', scratchin', bitin' and everything.
translation.ko: - 쿡 씨를 물려고 했다고요? - 네, 때리고 할퀴고 물었어요 되는대로 뭐든 했어요

translation.en: Finally, I got up and grabbed a pistol.
I started shootin'.
[man] And how many times did you fire this pistol?
Three times.
Did you know you struck Mr. Cooke?
Yes, 'cause he said, "Lady, you shot me."
I didn't believe that Sam was killed the way they say they did.
translation.ko: 저는 그런 식으로 샘이 죽었다는 걸 안 믿어요

translation.en: I didn't make sense of that, and Papa Cook didn't make sense of that.
translation.ko: 말이 안 돼요 아버지도 받아들이지 못했고요

translation.en: I don't believe it. That's far as I go with that.
That just didn't sound like him at all, at all.
I never seen him be aggressively at-at-at a lady.
translation.ko: 그렇게 공격적으로 여자를 대하는 모습을 본 적이 없어요

translation.en: Sam wasn't that kind of a guy.
[stammers] That's totally bullshit.
He wasn't that kind of a guy that had to be domineering or have power over people.
I never saw that in Sam ever.
translation.ko: 그런 모습 단 한 번도 못 봤어요

translation.en: It turns out that she was a hooker, and she was a Hollywood hooker.
translation.ko: 알고 보니 할리우드 매춘부였죠 "모텔에 있던 여성 콜걸로 드러나"

translation.en: There was the idea that the girl had come to this place before,
translation.ko: "모텔에 있던 여성 콜걸로 드러나" 그 여자가 이 장소에 이미 와본 적이 있었고

translation.en: and she threw his pants out the window, which had all his money in the pant--
translation.ko: 샘의 바지를 창문 밖에 던져 돈을 다 가져갔단 얘기가 있었죠

translation.en: the $5,000 I told you about earlier.
Somebody was out there, her pimp,
and grabbed the pants, and then she ran out with that person.
translation.ko: 포주가 바지를 받고 그 여자와 달아났어요

translation.en: And rumor had it that Bertha was in with the mob.
That she was like a pimpess or something.
It was ruled that Bertha Franklin shooting Sam Cooke
translation.ko: 버사 플랭클린이 샘 쿡을 총으로 살해한 건

translation.en: was a case of justifiable homicide,
and nobody bought that.
It just didn't seem like he was the person that got shot down in the way that he did.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 죽을 사람으로는 안 보였거든요

translation.en: There had to be something more in play,
and that's what fueled the idea of this being some sort of conspiracy.
translation.ko: 그런 생각 때문에 음모론까지 나오게 됐어요

translation.en: Elvis believed that there was a sense in the music industry
translation.ko: 엘비스는 음악 산업계에 샘의 영향력이 너무 커져서 저지해야 한다는

translation.en: that Sam was getting too powerful and had to be stopped,
translation.ko: 샘의 영향력이 너무 커져서 저지해야 한다는 여론이 있었다고 생각해요

translation.en: which echoed what a lot of people in the black community thought.
translation.ko: 흑인 사회에 많은 사람들 역시 그렇게 생각했고요

translation.en: You know, that this was about a black man who didn't know his place,
and to stop him, he had to be murdered.
They didn't mind Sam seepin' through the cracks
and being successful on his own.
But the problem was that too many other entertainers
were watching Sam and listening to Sam.
That was the problem.
There's another wild theory that Allen Klein killed Sam Cooke.
translation.ko: 앨런 클라인이 샘 쿡을 죽였다는 다른 황당한 이론도 있었어요

translation.en: Well, from what I hear...
he had the argument with Allen,
maybe two, three days before.
Allen Klein loved Sam Cooke, but he also was a thief.
translation.ko: 앨런 클라인은 샘 쿡을 사랑했지만 도둑이기도 했죠

translation.en: He used his love to steal his songs.
Klein was ready to take everything.
He did a similar thing to the Rolling Stones,
and he was one of the forces that broke up The Beatles.
Well, the problem with that is that in 1964,
Allen Klein didn't have the kind of power to set up this big, elaborate murder
translation.ko: 앨런 클라인은 그런 큰 사건을 준비할 힘이 없었어요

translation.en: where the police is gonna be a part of it, too?
And the district attorney? Allen Klein--he wasn't that powerful yet.
translation.ko: 검사도 그렇고요 앨런 클라인이 그 정도의 힘은 없었죠

translation.en: I was on a plane coming back from New York,
and I hadn't seen Barbara in quite some time,
and as I recall, she said, "I sold Sam's work, and I got $50,000."
translation.ko: 저한테 그러더군요 샘의 노래들을 팔았는데 5만 달러인가 받았다고요 말도 안 되는 액수였어요

translation.en: Or something. Some ridiculous amount of money.
translation.ko: 5만 달러인가 받았다고요 말도 안 되는 액수였어요

translation.en: I mean, obviously it's worth millions and millions and millions of dollars.
KAGS, which was the publishing company, and SAR Records...
all went to Allen Klein.
J.W. Alexander died broke.
What it is is inequality.
What it is is someone was in a position to take advantage and they did.
translation.ko: 누군가 유리한 위치에 있는 사람이 모두 차지했어요

translation.en: It's a double pain. The pain of losing Sam and the pain of, uh...
translation.ko: 이중의 고통을 겪었죠 샘을 잃은 고통에

translation.en: losing what he worked for,
what he was all about, what he fought to establish.
translation.ko: 그게 샘의 전부고 투쟁해서 이뤄낸 건데요

translation.en: Whether or not there was any real conspiracy that went down,
we won't know because there wasn't a thorough investigation done to find out
translation.ko: 저희는 모르죠 철저하게 조사를 안 했으니까요

translation.en: because to many people in the LAPD who were investigating this case,
translation.ko: 이 사건을 조사하던 LA 경찰 대부분에게

translation.en: and just to be quite frank, Sam Cooke was another nigger...
translation.ko: 솔직히 말해서 샘 쿡은 그저 흑인일 뿐이고

translation.en: and this was just more nigger shit.
And it didn't deserve any more attention than what it got.
When you see someone as prominent as Sam Cooke...
get killed like that under very mysterious circumstances,
and even his life is not valuable enough to have a real investigation
translation.ko: LA 경찰에서는 그의 목숨을 하찮게 보고

translation.en: by local law enforcement there in Los Angeles...
it's not a surprise that to this day,
there are a lot of people who still believe
that there was some sort of cover-up, some sort of conspiracy around the death of Sam Cooke.
translation.ko: 은폐나 음모가 있었다고 생각하는 건 당연해요

translation.en: I mean, what else are we gonna think, particularly given our history in America,
translation.ko: 미국에서 흑인의 역사나 사법당국과의 관계를 보면

translation.en: our relationships with law enforcement all over the country,
and the fact that if you happen to be a black person
who speaks out in any kind of way,
translation.ko: 어떤 흑인이 어떤 식으로든 당당하게 나서서 의견을 밝히고

translation.en: who does anything that seems to be empowering for the black community,
translation.ko: 흑인 인권 신장을 위해 뭐라도 한다면

translation.en: you are automatically a target.
If we were to transpose today back to then,
translation.ko: 요즘 같았으면 그런 일이 일어났을 때

translation.en: we would say black lives matter. Right?
translation.ko: 흑인 목숨도 중요하다고 하겠죠 안 그래요?

translation.en: And in 1964,
translation.ko: 그런데 1964년에 샘 쿡이라도 그 목숨은 중요하지 않았어요

translation.en: even Sam Cooke's black life didn't matter. Right?
translation.ko: 그런데 1964년에 샘 쿡이라도 그 목숨은 중요하지 않았어요 그렇죠?

translation.en: So... it's-it's-it's just hard to overcome that.
Do I think that the events of Sam Cooke
and the institutional attitude contribute to the upcoming riots here?
translation.ko: 그 후에 일어난 폭동에 영향을 미쳤다고 보느냐고요?

translation.en: Well, absolutely. Absolutely.
I don't wanna say Sam Cooke's death caused the Watts riots.
translation.ko: 샘 쿡의 죽음이 와츠 폭동의 원인이라고 말하고 싶진 않아요

translation.en: I don't wanna say that.
But Sam Cooke's death is a really big example of a million things
translation.ko: 하지만 샘 쿡의 죽음은 미국 흑인들 사이에

translation.en: that caused dissatisfaction among black people in America.
translation.ko: 불만을 일으킨 수백 가지 사건의 아주 대표적인 예죠

translation.en: Those people being, you know, murdered, being enslaved, being imprisoned.
Like, all of that, is why.
And Sam Cooke is yet another example of that.
Black people don't trust law enforcement for good reason.
translation.ko: 흑인은 사법당국을 안 믿어요 그만한 이유가 있어요

translation.en: It is not beyond the realm of possibility to a lot of people
translation.ko: FBI가 샘 쿡의 죽음과 어떤 연관이 있을 거라고

translation.en: that the FBI was somehow involved in Sam Cooke's death.
That he was set up in some way,
that he was murdered because he was just becoming too threatening,
you know, through the work he was doing, the people he was associating with,
and the music he was now gonna start making.
See, it's one thing to have a little meeting.
It's another thing to put out a song that could sell a million copies
translation.ko: 또 백만 장이 팔릴 법한 노래가 나오고

translation.en: and is on the radio, and everyone's gonna start to hear and absorb.
So, you know, people, whether it was true or not...
deeply felt that, you know, the government was involved in this.
In a very short period of time...
translation.ko: 아주 짧은 기간 동안 "흑인 인권 단체 임원 잭슨에서 살해되다"

translation.en: Medgar Evers, Sam Cooke,
Malcolm X,
King a little later.
translation.ko: 그 후에는 마틴 루서 킹이 있었고

translation.en: Langston Hughes isn't killed by the state, but, you know, there are very real losses.
translation.ko: 살해당한 건 아니지만 랭스턴 휴스 등 그들의 죽음은 막심한 손실이에요

translation.en: Something really...
powerful and important and intimate to blackness,
it gets lost with those deaths.
That's a part that white America will never fundamentally understand.
translation.ko: 백인 미국인들은 근본적으로 절대 이해 못 할 부분이에요

translation.en: What we know is that we never got to see him as a fully mature artist
and thinker and activist
who, had he lived, would've had a dramatic impact on the next generation
translation.ko: 차세대 아티스트, 사상가 운동가들에게 미쳤을 큰 영향력을

translation.en: of artists, thinkers, and activists.
We could've had this monument to what was to come.
translation.ko: 이런 기념비적인 성과를 거둘 수도 있었는데 말이죠

translation.en: "A Change is Gonna Come," there it is. But that's all we have.
The song isn't released until after he dies.
translation.ko: 그 노래는 샘이 죽은 후에도 발표되지 않았어요

translation.en: "Change is Gonna Come" is the perfect ending
for a career that was way too short... for a life that was way too truncated.
translation.ko: 그의 삶과 너무 짧았던 경력에 맞는 완벽한 마지막 곡이에요

translation.en: It was a long time coming in 1964,
and it is the shame of this nation...
that that song should still be so relevant.
The activism is one thing, but the music is powerful.
translation.ko: 정치적인 활동도 그렇지만 노래에는 힘이 있어요

translation.en: "Change is Gonna Come" communicates the rent of black life in America,
translation.ko: '변화가 찾아올 거야'는 미국에서 흑인들의 삶의 대가를 이야기해요

translation.en: and Sam Cooke taps into that with such poetry.
translation.ko: 샘 쿡은 아름다운 가사로 그 점을 노래했죠

translation.en: ♪ Oh ♪
♪ There've been times that I thought ♪
♪ I couldn't last-- ♪
It's meant to touch the soul, you see. That's what this song is about.
translation.ko: 이 난장판이 영혼을 시험하죠 그런 내용의 노래예요

translation.en: ♪ Now I think I'm able ♪
♪ To carry on ♪
♪ It's been a... .♪
It's his eulogy, the greatest gift he could've given us.
translation.ko: 샘의 찬미가이자 저희에게 준 최고의 선물이에요

translation.en: ♪ A long time comin' ♪ ♪ But I know ♪
-♪ A change gonna come ♪ -♪Change gonna come ♪
[both] ♪ Oh, yes, it will ♪
Yes, it will.
[man] All I can say to you, darling, is Sam Cooke's yours.
He'll never grow old. Sam, it's been nice.
translation.ko: 절대 늙지 않을 거예요 샘, 즐거웠습니다

translation.en: -It's been wonderful. -Thank you.
You're welcome.
